plugins.name: DoJavaScript
plugins.description:
クリップボードにコピーしてあるJavaScriptをFigma上で実行できるプラグインです。


ユーティリティー系のアプリと組み合わせることで、Figmaのさまざまな操作をショートカットキーでカスタマイズすることを目的に作成しました。


想定しているユーティリティー系アプリはKeyboard Maestroです。

  1. Keyboard Maestroで、クリップボードにFigmaを操作するJavaScriptをセットする
  2. Keyboard MaestroでFigmaのメニューバーの［プラグイン］→［DoJavaScript］を選択する
  3. 実行が終わったらKeyboard Maestroでセットしたクリップボードは破棄する


Keyboard Maestroでこれら一連の操作をまとめたマクロにショートカットキーを設定すれば、好きなショートカットキーで任意のJavaScriptをFigma上で実行できるようになります。


■使用イメージ

下記投稿のようなFigma APIの実行を好きなショートカットキーで実行できるようになります。

https://twitter.com/31mskz10/status/1684541017561903104


これは下記のFigma APIを使ったJavaScriptをKeyboard Maestroでコピーし、プラグインを実行して実現しています。

const selection = figma.currentPage.selection.slice()
for (let node of selection) {
node.resize(200, 300)
}
plugins.tagline: Execute the JavaScript copied to the clipboard.

plugins.name: StuDocreator
plugins.description:
A small text generator for books, courses and documents.


To generate this text, simply have text fields selected and click on whichever data you want to generate.


Example: If you want to generate a Document Title, select a text field and click on the 'Title' button under the 'Documents' section.

If you want to generate a Book Author, select a text field and click on the 'Author' button under the 'Books' section.


If you would like to generate all the data of a section, for example the Title, Course and Institution of a Document, you need to have three text fields selected each named appropriately. The fields should be named by section and type, so section_type


Example. Select 3 text fields named

  1. document_title
  2. document_course
  3. document_institution

And click on the Document button in the Documents tab. This will generate all information into these text fields.

plugins.name: Image Text Extractor (AI)
plugins.description:
Simply select any image layer or frame, click "Extract Text," and watch as the plugin captures all visible text while preserving line breaks and formatting.


Add extracted text directly to your Figma designs with a single click - either as a single element or separated by line breaks.


Unlike other OCR solutions, our plugin works entirely within Figma, eliminating the need to switch between apps or use external services.


Powered by Google's Gemini 1.5 Flash model, it delivers superior accuracy with support for multiple languages and complex layouts.


Perfect for designers working with client mockups, UI screenshots, or any design asset containing text that needs to be extracted and edited.

plugins.name: Catalyst MUI Plugin
plugins.description:
This plugin is specifically designed to streamline the workflow for teams utilizing a Design System built with MUI (Material UI) v6.1.0. Its primary function is to enable the seamless exportation of the Design System theme directly from Figma into a format compatible with Material UI-based projects.

Key Features:

  1. Theme Exportation: The plugin generates a JSON theme file containing all key design tokens and styles defined in the Figma Design System.
  2. Comprehensive Style Coverage: The exported JSON includes:
  3. Typography: Font families, weights, sizes, and line heights.
  4. Colors: Primary, secondary, and custom color palettes.
  5. Shapes: Border radii, component shapes, and other styling details.
  6. Spacing: Margins, paddings, and grid spacings.
  7. Breakpoints: Responsive design breakpoints for consistent behavior across devices.
  8. Component Styles: Custom styling for MUI components, ensuring pixel-perfect design fidelity.
  9. React App Integration: The JSON file can be directly imported into your MUI Material-based React application, enabling effortless theming and ensuring design-to-development consistency.
  10. Customization Made Easy: Developers can use the exported JSON as an overridden theme file in Material UI, allowing for easy customization and updates to the theme as the Design System evolves.

This plugin eliminates manual theme configuration, saving time and reducing errors, while ensuring that your Design System is accurately reflected in the final product. It’s a must-have tool for development teams aiming for seamless collaboration between design and code.
plugins.tagline: Catalyst MUI Plugin

plugins.name: TextColor2Android
plugins.description:
该插件支持将 Figma TextNode 的颜色导出成 Android 的 colors.xml 和 Compose 的 Color.kt 格式


How to use

  1. 打开插件
  2. 选中所有你需要导出的 TextNode 节点
  3. 选择导出成 Xml or Compose 格式
  4. Copy to Clipboard


导出成 Xml 的示例

<color name="textNode1">FFFFFFFF</color>
<color name="textNode2">FF000000</color>
<color name="textNode3">40000000</color>
<color name="textNode4">D9000000</color>
<color name="textNode5">D9000000</color>


导出成 Compose Colors.kt 的示例

val textNode1 = Color(0xFFFFFFFF)
val textNode2 = Color(0xFF000000)
val textNode3 = Color(0x40000000)
val textNode4 = Color(0xD9000000)
val textNode5 = Color(0xD9000000)


Github 链接

https://github.com/sunnyswag/Color2Android


---------------------------------------------------------------------


This plugin supports exporting the color of Figma TextNodes into Android's colors.xml and Compose's Color.kt formats.


How to use

  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select all the TextNode elements you need to export
  3. Choose to export as Xml or Compose format
  4. Copy to Clipboard


Example of export to Xml

<color name="textNode1">FFFFFFFF</color>
<color name="textNode2">FF000000</color>
<color name="textNode3">40000000</color>
<color name="textNode4">D9000000</color>
<color name="textNode5">D9000000</color>


Example of export to Compose Colors.kt

val textNode1 = Color(0xFFFFFFFF)
val textNode2 = Color(0xFF000000)
val textNode3 = Color(0x40000000)
val textNode4 = Color(0xD9000000)
val textNode5 = Color(0xD9000000)


Github link

https://github.com/sunnyswag/Color2Android
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma TextNode Colors to XML and Kotlin Seamlessly

plugins.name: Lingoport Localyzer
plugins.description:
Fast-track your FIGMA design work for translation via Lingoport’s FIGMA connector to Localyzer. Lingoport provides a full range of continuous localization solutions. Translate now with an automated process, whether with humans or machines, so that localization moves at the speed of development. Use machine translation or pseudo-localize so you can immediately see how your U/I will look in target languages. For more information, visit https://lingoport.com.



Getting Started

To get started, you will need a Lingoport Command Center API user account and at least one project set up with Localyzer. To set up an account, please contact us.


Launch The Plugin

1. Open your Figma design file.

2. Go to Plugins and select Lingoport Localyzer.

3. Log in with your Command Center username, generated API token, and URL to the server you are connecting to.

4. Select one of your existing Command Center projects to connect to the Figma file.

6. Select "Finish Setup" to save the selected project.


Using The Plugin

When setup is complete, you can start using the plugin by exporting selected strings to your saved Command Center project. Once translations are complete on Command Center, you can translate your Figma designs into your target languages.



Need Help?

Please contact us at figma@lingoport.com for any questions or assistance.

accepted.name: Lingoport
accepted.description: Since 2001, Lingoport has been helping companies internationalize and localize their software using our suite of products and expert i18n services.

plugins.tagline: Easily translate Figma designs (strings) into different languages.

plugins.name: Button States Generator
plugins.description:
Enhance your design workflow with the Button States Generator and create consistent, accessible button components effortlessly.


Overview


The Button States Generator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of button components with multiple states: Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.


Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com

accepted.name: Luc Hespel
accepted.description: UI / UX / IxD

plugins.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

plugins.name: Flutter Color Variables
plugins.description:
Simple plugin that generates Flutter/Dart Color constants from your Figma color variables.


Example Export:

import 'dart:ui';

enum ColorsMode {
lightMode,
darkMode
}

class Colors {
// Single-value colors
static Color primaryColor = const Color(0xFF000000);

// Mode-dependent colors
static Color backgroundColor(ColorsMode mode) {
switch (mode) {
case ColorsMode.lightMode:
return const Color(0xFFFFFFFF);
case ColorsMode.darkMode:
return const Color(0xFF000000);
}
}
}
plugins.tagline: Generate Flutter/Dart code for your color variables

plugins.name: Drag & Drop FPO
plugins.description:
Drag & Drop FPO : Anywhere in your layout


As the name suggest, drag & drop the FPO marker over the content or images in your layout that are placeholder content. It helps communicate within the internal team or the clients or dev team, as to which content will be updated in future.


If your designs are in Auto-Layout, the dropped "FPO" will be positioned "ABSOLUTE" and won't interfere within the set auto-layout.


"FPO" placed over the frame without the auto-layout will appear on top-left corner.


Feel Free to reach out with any Feedback, thanks for using the plugin !

plugins.name: GOST | General Organization & Structure Tool
plugins.description:
GOST | General Organization & Structure Tool


🚀 Tired of messy components and scattered layouts? GOST organizes Component Sets, UI layouts, and sections, ensuring clarity, consistency, and developer-friendly documentation.


🎯 Why Use GOST?


✅ Save time – No more manual sorting and structuring.

✅ Keep your project organized – Structured variants, grouped layouts, auto-wrapped sections.

✅ Improve documentation – Clear labels and descriptions for components.

✅ Boost consistency – Standardized component wrapping and layout structuring.


⸻


🛠️ Key Features


🔹 Structure Components


Organizes Component Sets into a labeled Variants Grid and optionally generates a documentation sheet.


✅ Options:

•Primary Axis – Arrange properties in rows or columns.

•Bake Documentation – Auto-generate a property sheet.

•Section Style – Define the visual style.

•Sort Nodes – Reorder elements inside the section.


📝 How to use:

1️⃣ Select a Component Set.

2️⃣ Run “Structure Components”.

3️⃣ Adjust sorting/documentation settings.

4️⃣ Get a structured matrix with optional documentation.


⸻


🔹 Structure Layouts


Groups and arranges layouts based on naming conventions (e.g., "chat", "chat / typing").


✅ Option:

•Section Style – Choose a predefined appearance.


📝 How to use:

1️⃣ Ensure layouts have clear names.

2️⃣ Run “Structure Layouts”.

3️⃣ The plugin organizes them.


⸻


🔹 Build Component


A faster way to apply sorting rules and documentation.


✅ Options:

•Primary Axis – Arrange variants.

•Bake Documentation – Enable/disable property sheets.


📝 How to use:

1️⃣ Select a Component Set.

2️⃣ Run “Build Component”.

3️⃣ Sorting and documentation are applied.


⸻


🔹 Wrap to Section


Neatly wraps any selection into a section, improving clarity.


✅ Options:

•Section Style – Choose a visual look.

•Sort Nodes – Reorder elements or keep positions.


📝 How to use:

1️⃣ Select frames, layers, or components.

2️⃣ Run “Wrap to Section”.

3️⃣ The plugin creates a structured section.


⸻


⚙️ Preferences & Customization


🎛️ Set default values for:

•Primary Axis – Default row/column arrangement.

•Bake Documentation – Enable/disable property sheets.

•Section Style – Standardized look for sections and layouts.


♻️ Need to reset? Restore plugin settings to default (⚠️ May affect styles).


📝 Customize:

1️⃣ Open GOST → Preferences → Select Default Values.

2️⃣ Adjust settings.

3️⃣ Plugin remembers preferences.


⸻


🚀 Quick Actions

•Rebuild Component – Instantly update a processed component set.


⸻


📩 Get in Touch!


📧 Email: kitosorgin@gmail.com

💬 Telegram: @kitosorgin

accepted.name: Kit Osorgin
accepted.description:
OSORGIN Design Bureau —
Design-director & co-founder

plugins.name: Accessibility Simulator
plugins.description:
Explore and understand accessibility considerations in your designs through experimental simulations. This plugin offers three key features:


  1. Vision Simulator: Test how your designs appear to users with different visual conditions including cataracts, glaucoma, deuteranopia, and diabetic retinopathy.
  2. Motor Control Analysis: Evaluate interaction accessibility by analyzing target sizes and click difficulty based on standard guidelines.
  3. Cognitive Load Analysis: Assess visual complexity and text readability to optimize user comprehension.


How to use:

  1. Select any element in your design
  2. Choose a simulation type
  3. Review the analysis and suggested improvements
  4. Use insights as a starting point for further accessibility testing


Limitations:

  1. Simulations are approximate and may not perfectly reflect actual user experiences
  2. Should not replace professional accessibility audits
  3. Best used during the design process for early feedback and learning


Important note: This is an experimental tool intended for early-stage testing and learning. Results should not be used as a final assessment - always validate your designs with professional accessibility testing and real user feedback.

accepted.name: Barsha Maharjan
accepted.description: One solution at a time

plugins.tagline: Vision simulation, Motor control analysis and Cognitive load analysis initial experimental simulator

plugins.name: Export variables to Github repository
plugins.description:
Introduction


Export all Figma variables as .json file to a Github repository.

All variables collections are exported.


Variables json structure is mapped from the getLocalVariablesAsync api function as following:

{
id: variable.id,
name: variable.name,
type: variable.resolvedType,
values: variable.valuesByMode
}


Plugin settings


Username: the username of the repository owner.

Repository: the name of the repository.

Path: the folders path where to save the variables file. Folder and sub folders must already exist in your repo.

File name: the name of the variables file.

Access Token: the Github access token needed to push on your repository. The access token must have read and write permission for Contents. Check the documentation on how to create an access token.

Commit message: add a short comment related to the modifications done.


All the settings are mandatory but the commit message.


Plugin functionalities


Save & Export: save the settings and push the variables file to your repository.

Download: locally download the variables file.

Reset settings: reset the plugin settings to default.
plugins.tagline: Export variables to Github repository

plugins.name: Better Duplicate
plugins.description:
Duplicate selected frames to the right or downwards. Frames would be automatically arranged in a row or column based on their positions.


While iterating on a new design I felt a lot of friction from the native frame duplication process: it's hard to quickly duplicate frames and make sure they end up exactly where I want. Additionally, they can only be duplicated horizontally on canvas while I frequently add vertical iterations as well. Native duplication also doesn't work with multiple frames. To avoid needing to manually arrange frames while iterating quickly I created this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames right or down using smart algorithms for their placement

plugins.name: Contrast checker
plugins.description:
Contrast Checker is a Figma plugin designed to help designers ensure their designs are accessible by automatically analyzing text and background color contrast within selected frames. The plugin checks for compliance with accessibility standards, highlights potential issues, and provides detailed reports, enabling you to create inclusive and user-friendly designs effortlessly.



What the Plugin Does


•Automatic Contrast Analysis: The plugin scans selected frames to identify text elements and their background colors, calculating the contrast ratio between them.

•Accessibility Compliance: It checks whether the contrast ratios meet the WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) standards, specifically for normal and large text.

•Detailed Reports: After analysis, the plugin generates a comprehensive report that highlights any text elements that do not meet the required contrast ratios, providing actionable feedback.

•Issue Highlighting: Users can locate specific elements with contrast issues directly within their design by using the “Locate” feature.

•Ignore Option: If certain elements are intentionally designed with lower contrast, users can choose to ignore those specific issues.



How to Use the Plugin


1.Select a Frame: Start by selecting the frame or frames within your Figma document that you want to analyze.

2.Run the Plugin: Launch the Contrast Checker plugin. It will automatically start analyzing the selected frame(s).

3.View the Report: Once the analysis is complete, view the detailed report generated by the plugin. This report will list all the text elements within the frame(s) and indicate whether they meet the required contrast ratio.

4.Address Issues: Use the “Locate” button to find and fix elements with contrast issues in your design.

5.Manage Issues: Optionally, ignore any issues that you don’t need to fix by using the “Ignore” feature.



Limitations


•Text Detection: The plugin only analyzes visible text elements and solid background colors. It may not correctly analyze text with gradient backgrounds, images, or complex overlays.

•Performance: The plugin performs best on smaller frames or a limited number of selected frames at once. Analyzing very large frames with numerous text elements may take longer.

•Customization: Currently, the plugin does not support custom contrast thresholds beyond the WCAG standards, and it does not provide options for customizing the analysis parameters.


By using the Contrast Checker, designers can ensure their work is accessible, improving the overall inclusivity of their designs.
plugins.tagline: boost accessibility w/ seamless contrast checks — ensure every design is inclusive & user-friendly!

plugins.name: Batch Description Update
plugins.description:
Adding a description to your Figma's components brings some benefits. When it comes to icons, adding terms and tags can help users find icons in the asset panel. However, maintaining component descriptions can be a lot of work, especially for a long set of icons. This plugin allows users to update all component descriptions with three clicks.

  • Create a .CSV file where the first column is the component name and the second is the desired description;
  • Run the plugin 'Batch Description Update', select the .CSV file, and run the process;
  • Done! Your components have their descriptions updated in no time.

accepted.name: Leonardo Ratzlaff
accepted.description: Senior Product Designer at Dell

Intro

Create stunning colour palettes or find perfect colour combinations especially the right shades of greys, tailor-made for every project in seconds.


Whether you're starting out, especially if you’re starting out or a seasoned pro, use Tinte to generate colours, shades and all the greys you need for your projects — websites, apps etc. 


And with Tinte, you get the Hex, HSL and RGB codes.


How to Use?

You can use Tinte in two ways;


1. If you have a base colour code, just input the colour code in to the text prompt and Tinte will do the rest.


2. If you don’t have a colour code, don’t worry, you can still use Tinte. All you have to do is provide some information about your project and Tinte will have options for you in seconds. 


Privacy

We do not retain or store your palettes.

Transform your usability testing with Klever's new desktop-powered solution. This beta version brings advanced automation capabilities to our AI-powered testing platform, enabling comprehensive prototype analysis and real browser interactions.


Demo


https://youtu.be/Dru78eszvsM


Key Features

* 🔄 Complete User Flow Testing

* 🤖 Advanced AI Analysis (GPT-4V)

* 🌐 Real Browser Automation

* 🎯 Natural Interaction Commands

* 📊 Comprehensive Testing Reports



Requirements

* KleverDesktop companion app (Download from GitHub)

* Chrome browser (auto-installed if needed)

* Choice of LLM:

* OpenAI API key

* Local LLM setup (e.g., Ollama)

* Enterprise configuration



Getting Started

1. Install KleverDesktop from GitHub

2. Launch the desktop companion

3. Install this Figma plugin
